Term.Name: All Pass
Term.Definition: No spectral information are affected, but the phase will be manipulated.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Low Pass
Term.Definition: Spectral information below a certain frequency passes trough.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: High Pass
Term.Definition: Spectral information above a certain frequency passes trough.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Band Pass
Term.Definition: Spectral information at and around a certain centre frequency are gradually passed trough.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Low Shelf
Term.Definition: Spectral information below a certain frequency are lowered or amplified in a evenly way.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: High Shelf
Term.Definition: Spectral information above a certain frequency are lowered or amplified in a evenly way.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Bell
Term.Definition: Spectral information at a certain centre frequency are lowered or amplified.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Notch
Term.Definition: Spectral information at a certain centre frequency are gradually removed.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Tilt
Term.Definition: Changes the balance of spectral information between the area below and over a certain centre frequency. Based on Fast Fourier Transformation.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project
